sentences.english: When she said that,I belted into her.
sentences.chinese: 她說了那事以後，我痛罵了她一頓。
他把他的兒子痛罵了一頓。

sentences.english: In Green's invective there is the starveling author's jealousy of the prosperous actor.
sentences.chinese: 格林的痛罵聲裏包含潦倒作家對發跡演員的嫉妒。

sentences.english: If she does that again I'll really give her a piece of my mind.
sentences.chinese: 如果她再做，我真的要痛罵她一頓了。

sentences.english: You'll catch it if Mrs Brown finds you trampling on her flowers beds.
sentences.chinese: 如果布朗太太發現你踩她的花壇，你會挨一頓痛罵。

sentences.english: The boss sailed into me for leaving the office unlocked when I went to lunch.
sentences.chinese: 就因爲我去喫午餐沒把門鎖上，老闆痛罵了我一頓。

sentences.english: The boss rapped me on knuckles for failing to spot the mistake.
sentences.chinese: 老闆因我不能找出差錯而痛罵了我一頓。

sentences.english: Is biting your daughter's head off for academic reasons justified?
sentences.chinese: 爲了學業原因痛罵女兒，正當合理嗎？

sentences.english: Working late into the night, Niederhoffer berated himself for leaving himself so exposed.
sentences.chinese: 尼德霍夫工作到深夜，痛罵自己的倉位太重。

sentences.english: She abused him soundly for his neglect.
sentences.chinese: 因疏忽被她痛罵了一頓。

sentences.english: The boy asked for a leave to watch the football match. When he returned his father gave him Jessie.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩請假去看足球賽，回來時被他父親痛罵了一頓。

sentences.english: Fishermen blasted officials after octopus prices plummeted. "The fishermen here are dumbfounded , " said Im Hyun-ki, head of an octopus production association in South Jeolla province.
sentences.chinese: 在章魚的價格暴跌後，漁民們詛咒痛罵政府官員。

sentences.english: He greeted me with a stream of abuse, which made me feel sad.
sentences.chinese: 他迎面對我一頓痛罵，這使我很難過。

sentences.english: You will be skinned alive by your mother.
sentences.chinese: 你準會挨你母親一頓痛罵。

sentences.english: I let him have his say, and then I laid into him.
sentences.chinese: 我讓他把話說完，然後把他痛罵了一頓。

definition: dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
